Saf.AI

Created at a Hackathon in October 2017, Saf.AI is a mobile app that aims to help people keep their surroundings clean and encourages better methods of waste disposal.
Saf.AI won the first prize at said hackathon.

The name Saf.AI is a play on the Hindi word safai, meaning 'to clean.' True to its name, this app aims to combat the problem of garbage-strewn streets and dirty surroundings faced by millions of Indians each day.

Saf.AI lets users click a picture of a dirty area/street and upload it to a platform. The image is then viewed by a community of thousands of users, NGOs, and ragpicking teams — who can volunteer to clean up the waste. Saf.AI also utilises Google's Cloud Vision image recognition API to identify the waste in an image and its recyclability on a scale of 10, allowing users to schedule a pickup to ensure that the waste is disposed properly.

A prototype of the app can be found here. A product video and can be found below.
